summary: This is an internal FBI email update regarding the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, dated September 17, 2019. It reports on Maxwell's location with her boyfriend in Massachusetts, her departure due to media scrutiny, and the FBI's efforts to track a cell phone believed to belong to her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI update; reported to have been staying with her boyfriend in Massachusetts but left after media scrutiny. The FBI is tracking a cell phone believed to belong to her.

persons.name: Scott Borgenson
persons.context: Identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's boyfriend, living in Manchester By the Sea, MA. The local police were in contact with him in August, and Maxwell was with him before leaving.

connections.description: Described as boyfriend-girlfriend; Maxwell was reportedly staying with Borgenson in Massachusetts.

events.title: Police contact with Scott Borgenson
events.description: The Manchester By the Sea Police Department was in contact with Scott Borgenson earlier in August regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's presence.

events.title: FBI subpoenas cell phone subscriber info
events.description: The FBI reports they have just subpoenaed subscriber information for a cell phone they believe belongs to Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was reportedly staying with her boyfriend, Scott Borgenson, in Manchester By the Sea, Massachusetts, in August 2019.
Maxwell left the location after increased media scrutiny surrounding her.
The local police department had a good relationship with Scott Borgenson and had been in contact with him.
The FBI was actively tracking a cell phone believed to belong to Maxwell and had just subpoenaed subscriber information for it.
This document is an internal FBI update from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit in the New York Office.
